channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Enfield council do not empty street bins in Winchmore Hill, 28th July
item.description:
Although generally the borough is a tip and even the bins are not emptied, it is increasingly evident that Winchmore Hill is being targeted for less cleaning and increasingly ghettoised. Today the bins across EN2 had all been emptied but Winchmore Hill had no bins cleaned on the entire stretch of green lanes and the hoppers road bin is an increasing health and safety hazard and never emptied despite being the only bin now for miles. The multi occupants allowed across green lanes in Winchmore Hill throw buns in the street every day without prosecution and opposite the little dragon pub is like this every single day. I have never seen it without overflowing waste bags spilling across the floor. Eversely park road bins are just never emptied. I have caught the fly tipper and have her address but the council never prosecute.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hoppers Road, Palmers Green, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Thames Water is doing some very dirty work at night, my family and I can't sleep, we didn't get any warning, 27th July
item.description:
Since Thursday there has been a water leak directly opposite our house, which Thames Water has been informed about many times, but they have decided to deal with it on Sunday night from 10 p.m. An excavator with a pneumatic hammer is working on the street. None of us have received any warning, which shouldn't be happening. My daughter, my wife, and I can't sleep because of the noise. I don't think this is normal.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Leigham Court Road, Streatham Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Huge wild tree growing outside of our garden and branches overhand our boundaries.branches falling on our land being dangerous, 27th July
item.description:
This is an old wild tree with huge branches which are growing onto our garden. Sometimes branches are falling and couple of times nearly hit my child. Some sort of produce of the tree is also falling (which are heavy) and causing us a distress and fear to use the garden. We don‚Äôt know whose tree that is but it overhangs into our land causing a lot of discomfort and stress.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wimborne Way, Elmers End, London
Report on FixMyStreet
